Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Preoperative Exercise in Pancreatic Cancer Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with pancreatic cancer were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either Arm A (enhanced usual care) or Arm B (prescribed aerobic and resistance exercise)

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate the effects of a preoperative, home-based exercise program

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the 6-minute walk distance (6MWD)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 151 patients were randomised, with 76 in Arm A and 75 in Arm B, recruited between specified dates

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 6MWD improved in both Arm A (mean change 18.6±56.8 m, P =0.01) and Arm B (27.3±68.1 m, P =0.002)
